dialogue.raw_text: That's not necessarily a bad thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I suppose not. But still. One would like to move along. To move beyond.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure we can escape our natures. Believe me I've tried. I'm not even so sure anymore that we should want to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love that you said that. It makes me feel a bit lighter. I've been rather heavy lately. Thinking about my childhood. Realizing how much a product I am of my upbringing. (beat, cautiously) I've been seeing someone. A therapist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (feigning surprise) You are a therapist, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No no. I'm a psychologist, but I do research. I'm a behaviorist. I work with animals. Mice at the moment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope you don't perform any of those dreadful torture experiments, Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heavens no. My work now is... Right now I'm teaching mice... well, table manners, to be candid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat. doesn't know what to say) How's it going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quite well, really. It's a lot of work. A lot of reinforcement, mostly positive. Right now I've gotten two of my subjects to use napkins. Tiny napkins of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Paper or cloth?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope you don't think me daft. It's important work. It's part of a larger sociological experiment. I'm federally funded.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the larger experiment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's my thesis that if table manners can be taught to mice, they can be taught to humans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Going out on a limb, aren't you, Nathan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (speech) The truth is most people don't have table manners today. And when the foundations of civilized society crumble and disappear, civilized society in its entirely follows closely at its heels.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stridently) Courtesy, decorum, manners, are all sadly lacking from our daily intercourse. Rudeness, vulgarity, meanness are the norm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are animals after all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ergo if I can teach table manners to mice, I can teach them to humans. If I can teach table manners to humans, I can save the world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lila lies on her back. Rose works on her breasts.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I really like him, Rose. He's so... (searching) ...passionate about his work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My brother says he likes you, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pleased) Really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Says he likes you even more than he likes his own mother. And according to my brother Nathan's abormally close with his mother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan talks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I began going to a therapist when I was in my thirties, because I felt that I wasn't enjoying life the way my friends were. (beat) After a time my childhood came up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is another sepia scene. Nathan as a ten year old sits at the table with his parents. There is a bowl of salad in front of each of them. Everyone's head is bowed in prayer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eyes open, and young Nathan reaches for a fork to eat the salad. He grabs the wrong fork. Mother's eyes widen in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan looks up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lord, we thank you for this bountiful gift we are about to receive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Amen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My God, no! My God! (disappointed) Oh, Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is the wrong fork, young man. (to father) Harold, tell the boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is the wrong fork, young man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (panicky) I'll use the right one. I'm sorry. I forgot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Harold, tell the boy more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Too late. Go to your room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Harold! Tell the boy again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at mother) No "buts." Go to your room now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at father) And?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And think about what you've done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Adult Nathan sits on the couch, dabbing at his eyes. Wendall, his therapist sits across from him and writes something in his notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan thinks long and hard about this. He seems to be really straining, squinting his eyes. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wendall nods and scribbles something on his pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wendall looks up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And do you think maybe this early childhood indoctrination has something to do with your interest in table manners in the present.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think so. No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you ask?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Everything's white. People in lab coats hustle back and forth. Nathan, also in a lab coat, is hovering over a Lucite encasement. Inside we see two white mice, both attached to electrodes. They sit in little chairs at a little table. In front of each of them is a little plate of salad and three forks of varying size under Lucite domes. Nathan nods to his pretty French assistant, Gabrielle, who presses a button. The Lucite domes over the salads lift. Tentatively both mice reach for a fork. There is a tiny piece of velcro on each mouse's paw and a tiny piece of velcro on each of the forks. The first mouse picks the correct fork, and stabs it into the salad and eats happily, relieved. The second mouse picks the wrong fork. Nathan presses a button, which sends the mouse flying off his chair with an electric shock. The correct mouse keeps eating, unconcerned. Nathan makes a note in his notebook. Gabrielle watches Nathan as he writes, enchanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The table is elegantly set, candlelit. Lila sits at it while Nathan fusses in the kitchenette. Something classical wafts over from the stereo in the living room. Nathan places a salad in front of Lila and sits across from her with his own salad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila picks up a fork from the inside of her setting, not the outside. Nathan blinks. Lila tastes the salad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a long silence as they both eat the salad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan pounds his forehead with his fist. Lila waves her hand to indicate that it's fine. She doesn't say anything because she's chewing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila takes a deep breath, about to go into it, thinks better of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan smiles, relieved. Lila smiles back. Nathan recoils slightly, skittishly half-points to his bared teeth. Apparently there's a piece of food stuck in Lila's teeth. She closes her mouth, runs her tongue over her teeth, smiles again, mouth closed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It looks wonderful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look wonderful. I'm on top of the world tonight, Lila. Work is going splendidly and my personal life is ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um-mmm. Oh Nathan, this salad is delish...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (clenched teeth) My God! The fork! The fork!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (strangely) Tell her, Harold... (stops himself) It's just that... It's nothing. It's just that the outside fork is the salad fork. One goes from the outside in as the dinner progresses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry. (picks up correct fork) I'm sorry, Nathan. I never really learned those things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (forced casual) No biggie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, this is good!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry that I became so upset.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm sorry. I'm really backward in certain areas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat, blurting) It's only that I really enjoy your company and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You really enjoy my company?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. (beat, blurting) Please don't talk with food in your mouth, Lila. Please. You're so pretty and it only mars your... I'm sorry. I'm being critical.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's just that I have some peculiarities, and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like you, too, Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah (beat) But I have some peculiarities also.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (happily) I don't care. I don't care! (then, concerned) Like what, for example?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rose is doing Lila's feet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My brother says things are going really well between you and Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I cannot believe how in love I am with this man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's so cute. I even like his cute little penis. It's like a little pig's penis or something. (beat) Rose, we connect on every level. I've finally found someone I can feel completely safe with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't throw that away. I had that once with a guy. But I threw it away for a cheap thrill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One night stand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I married a midget.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Marrying a midget was a cheap thrill?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well he wasn't really a midget. He was on the cusp of midgethood. That's what made it cheap. Had he been an actual midget, there would've been nothing cheap about it, my dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't know you were into that sort of thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me tell you, honey, midgets are the best kept secret in male companionship. They're portable. They're controllable. They're eager. And they're exactly the right height for a little covert oral fun on the dance floor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screams with delight, then:) I have a friend you might like to meet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three foot one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be still my crotch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rose, Nathan's no midget, but he's asked me to move in with him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. My brother told me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I think I'm going to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mulling it over) Stand on a stepladder sometimes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan looks around for some sign of another person. There is nobody.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lila moved in with me. Did I love her? I thought so. But from my new vantage point I realize that love is nothing more than a messy conglomeration of need, desperation, fear of death, insecurity about penis size, and the self-involved, ego driven need to collect other people's hearts. Not that I judge it. (puts head in hands. beat. looks up) Listen, I don't want to be dead yet. Is there any way to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No I suppose not. (beat) No biggie. Anyway, Lila moved in. We had our problems, but we both wanted love so badly, we turned a blind eye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan, Lila, and Nathan's parents (looking very, very old) sit at the dining room table. Salad is about to be eaten, and everyone glances sideways over at Lila, waiting for her to make her move. She reaches for the wrong fork, corrects herself and picks the salad fork. Nathan breathes a sigh of relief. His mother looks disappointed, clucks. They eat in silence. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His mother and father touch their faces reflexively, then look at each other and laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mother and father laugh again. Then they pull at their latex faces. The wrinkles come off. And they look exactly as they did in the flashback scene, albeit a bit pink-faced. There is another pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The father and Nathan laugh at mother's joke. Lila joins in weakly, against her better judgment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila hesitates.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's lovely to finally meet you, Mr. and Mrs. Bronfman. I've heard so much about you and I've seen you in photographs from Nathan's childhood, but it's nice to meet you in the flesh. I must say, you look exactly the same as in the photographs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually, Mother and Father, you look very, very old. You look terrible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nathan!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him, Harold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Son, your mother and I are doing a production of The Gin Game at the local community theater. We forgot to take off our make-up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (awkward) Goodness, you two look exactly as you did in those old photos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cold) Yes, so you mentioned earlier, dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (changing the subject) Lila's a nature writer, mother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love nature. As long as it stays in the zoo where it belongs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Lila) Don't you agree, dear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course she does, mother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan is in bed, in starched pajamas. He lies on his back under perfect covers and stares straight up at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila emerges from the bathroom, radiant, hopeful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila happily leaps into bed. She smothers Nathan with kisses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan kisses her ear. He looks confused, sticks his finger behind her ear, and pulls it out with a dab of shaving cream on it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (pissy) I'll be out in a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry about my parents.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) You didn't seem sorry when you were laughing at all your mother's stupid, tasteless, cruel animal jokes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was simply attempting to keep the evening light. You know that I feel similarly to you about nature.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course. (beat) I simply love the... naturalness of it all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you? Oh do you, darling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why certainly!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, darling. I'm so relieved. Let's celebrate with a long hike in the woods tomorrow!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (oh shit) That's a great idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It'll be wonderful! I'll show you my old stomping grounds!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Terrific. Can't wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shaving cream?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think so. (beat) Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan drives. He's dressed in spanking new, freshly starched safari clothes, big shiny new hiking boots. Lila sits in the front passenger seat. She is dressed in a costume identical to Nathan's, but, as opposed to Nathan, she seems awkward in it. She fidgets in it, straightens it, sighs, comes to terms with it, and looks dreamily out the window at the passing trees. She is home. That's all that matters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Darling, did you bring the insect repellent lotion?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, darling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) Oh, and the sun block?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What SPF, sweetie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fifteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perfectomundo! We are ready! (beat) Say, wouldn't it be wonderful to have an insect repellent lotion that also worked as a sun block? Think of all the time one would save.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, darling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think I'll get Johannsen in chemistry on that. (beat) Oh! Did you bring the first aid kit?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Flares?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Absolutely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We could call it "Quit Bugging Me, Sunny." (laughs a lot) Get it? Sunny. S-u-n-n-y.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs appreciatively) That's very funny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you so much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Puff testifies.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then, gentlemen, one day I saw something I hadn't seen since my father died in a freak accident involving a rotted log and four thousand bees stinging his head... I saw other human beings. They chattered away at each other in what appeared to be gibberish. Later I learned it was English. Now I wonder if perhaps my initial assessment hadn't been correct.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Puff's POV: Through some brush we watch Nathan and Lila hiking. We hear Puff's loud heavy breathing and, in the distance, the relentless gibberish chatter of Nathan and Lila. Puff moves. Lila glances over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila talks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It was a flash of white. I ruled out deer immediately. Too... upright.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We're with Lila and Nathan now. Lila has stopped and is peering into the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila walks in the direction of the sighting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila trudges through the brush. Nathan follows. Better than being left behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila is in her element. Her whole demeanor has changed. She is tracking. She sniffs the breeze, cocks her head, moves stealthily. Then she sheds her clothes, almost shaking them off, like a dog shaking off some cute costume his owner had dressed him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila turns her head and glares at Nathan. There is an animal fierceness in her eye that shuts him up instantly. She turns back to pursue her prey.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you see that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. Something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A deer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Too... upright. Might've been a person.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nervously) It might behoove us to turn back at this point.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (not budging) If it's a person, why should we go see it? It's not like it's nature or anything. It's just a person. (beat) Sometimes people who live in the woods don't want to be seen. They live in the woods because they're anti-social, Lila. We have to respect that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the way to get ticks, Lila. This is it. Bingo! Lyme Disease! You've hit the nail on the head here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh for God's sa...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Puff testifies.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I had never seen anything like it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Puff's POV: We see a naked Lila looking in our general direction, but not seeing us. The sun dapples her body. She moves closer and closer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It was an ape as I had never seen before. Like me, yet different in certain essential details. And all at once I felt a heat pass through me. My heart raced. Gentlemen, I wanted to touch her, to caress her, to be one with her. I had urges and desires I could not explain. I felt overwhelmed by the power this strange creature had over me, and so I did what any animal would do when it comes across an animal of superior strength...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cops are transfixed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He bolted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We are with Lila. She creeps along, when suddenly a tan, muscular figure tears out from behind a tree and runs, practically on all fours, through the dense underbrush. Lila follows, almost as agile as the forest creature. Nathan just stands there. The chase continues. There is a great deal of heaving and panting. Puff shimmies up a large tree. Lila follows. Puff leaps from branch to branch. Lila follows easily. Puff swings from a vine. So does Lila. Finally they come to the end of the trees, a clearing. There is no nowhere for Puff to leap. Lila is with him in the tree. They are crouched, bloody, heaving, on separate branches, staring at each other. After a long moment, Lila speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff cocks his head. The high timbre of her voice surprises him, pleases him, but he doesn't understand the words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff looks at his crotch. Apparently there is some activity down there. Lila, following his eyes, glances down there also.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff grabs for his crotch and begins to play with himself distractedly, looking at her all the while. He falls out of the tree. Lila gasps. Branches crack and snap as he passes through them and then there is an unpleasant thud when he hits the forest floor. Lila shimmies down the tree, and kneels by Puff. He is unconscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan comes limping through the brush. Somehow his safari suit and boots are as clean and pressed as they were in the car. He is carrying Lila's clothes. Somehow he has had time to neatly fold them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila looks up at icily at Nathan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila looks off into the distance, her eyes brimming with tears. As Nathan continues his speech, we move closer and closer into Lila's eyes. Nathan's voice fades into nothing by the time we dissolve.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't understand my language, do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing) I take it back, you do understand my language.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God! Is he dead? Please put something on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll catch cold. It's cold. (beat) What do you suppose he is, a survivalist?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think he's feral.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumping back) Feral? Don't touch him! He might be diseased! He might... My God, rabies!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He looks perfectly fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think we should go. Please. Before he wakes up and, I don't know, eats us, or whatever feral things do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand you. This is fascinating and you just want to run away. I mean, here we have a human being totally uncontaminated by civilization, totally free, and all you want to do is run back to your...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thinking) Actually, I just had an amusing thought.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (musing) Feral, huh? Totally uncontaminated?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at him. He doesn't understand English. He moves like an animal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's perfect!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nathan, what the hell are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (doing a little dance) Forget mice! Actually forget guinea pigs, cats, monkeys, and chimps also. I'm on to stage five: The human subject.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no. You can't take him from his home, Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ranting) Don't you see? He's my Tabula Rasa, my Eliza Dolittle. He's my ticket to the top of the Behaviorist food chain. He's going to make me famous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't allow you. It's wrong. He's happy here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is he, Lila? Is he happy living filthy and naked alone in this tick infested wilderness? Never to know the love of a good woman, never to revel in the pitter-patter of little feet, never to read Moby Dick, or marvel at a Monet, or just sit back after a day of hard but rewarding work, smoke a pipe, and wonder about the nature of reality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (weakening resolve) You'd be taking away his freedom, Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Freedom's just another word for nothing left to lose, Lila, to quote Janet Jackson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Belonging to something, a person or a society, is a basic human craving. We are communal creatures. This poor soul has no one, nothing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A naked, very hairy Lila sits by herself on the cliff and watches the sunset. There's a chill in the air and she shivers and hugs herself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh God, I have no one. Nothing. You give me this beautiful gift, this glorious sunset. But with no one to say "isn't that a beautiful sunset" to, it becomes meaningless, just another stupid sunset. They happen everyday. So what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lila is hovering over the unconscious Puff. Nathan's voice comes back into focus. He is still speechifying.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...what is it that makes us human, if not the knowledge that we are indeed human? Think of this poor soul's education as the greatest gift we could bestow upon...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Great. Grab his feet. We'll throw him in the trunk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan hovers over the Lucite case with the tiny dinner table in it. His assistant, Gabrielle, presses a button, a door opens, and two white mice scurry in. The male pulls out a chair for the female. The female climbs up on the chair, and the male pushes the chair in, then scurries around to the other side of the table and climbs onto his own chair. The Lucite lid over the silverware and salads lifts and both mice pick up the proper forks and begin eating. Nathan scribbles in his notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan looks up. Gabrielle jerks her head in the direction of a very large Lucite case. Inside, Puff, now dressed in a diaper and connected to all sorts of electrodes, is stirring. Nathan and Gabrielle hurry over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff groggily takes in his surroundings. This is quite a lot to take in. The white room, the strange apes in strange suits, his own clothing, the wires. After surveying the scene for a moment, Puff becomes frightened and agitated. He tries to escape. Not understanding Lucite, he smashes into it, again and again. He tears at his diaper. Nathan gives a nod to Gabrielle, who presses a button on a panel. An electric shock sends Puff flying. He lies on the floor confused and dazed. After a moment, he gets up and again crashes into the Lucite. Nathan gives the signal to Gabrielle and once again she shocks Puff. He once again gets up and crashes against the Lucite. Again he is shocked. He gets up again, and is about to crash against the Lucite, but he thinks better of it, and squats in place, immobilized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle likes this concept a great deal. She smiles and moves closer to Nathan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle poises her finger above the button. She winks at Nathan. He blushes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Doctor...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Gabrielle) Only three shocks. A chimp takes fifteen. This is going to be tres simple, no, Gabrielle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in love with Nathan) Oui, doctor, oui.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Puff) Good morning... (to Gabrielle) We need a name for him, don't we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oui.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You decide. Today is your day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really? My day? Well, I had a sweet little mongrel puppie named Puff when I was a girl. This one reminds me of my dog, all shaggy! So cute! (giggles girlishly) I loved my doggie very much, monsieur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (charmed) Puff it is then. Puff Bronfman. Is that okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oui. Perfect!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Puff) Good morning, Puff Bronfman. I'm Dr. Bronfman and this is my assistant Gabrielle. We're your mommy and daddy while you are here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Puff) How about some salad, son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan, carrying a brief case, is walking to his car. Gabrielle hurries to catch up to him. Her high heels click on the pavement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle pouts. Nathan is charmed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Bronfman! Dr. Bronfman!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Hi, Gabrielle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (out of breath) Hi. I just wanted to tell you that I very much enjoy working with you. (blushes) Now I'm embarrassed that I say this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Don't be. I really enjoy hearing that. You're a terrific assistant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Merci. I... Do you... would you like to go get a cup of coffee, perhaps?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I don't know. I'm actually on my way to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now I am truly embarrassed. Forgive me. I should not have asked such a stupid question. I know you are a very important man and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Don't be silly. It's just...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am a foolish little thing. I am pink in my face, no? It is only that I have been so lonely lately and... I am ashamed. I'll see you tomorrow, okay? Unless... Am I fired now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan and Gabrielle sit at a romantic little table in a trendy coffee shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle starts to cry softly. Nathan doesn't know what to do. His eyes dart around, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle looks up at him appreciatively. She sniffs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches across the table and touches his hand lightly for a moment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you so much for accompanying me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have had such a difficult time in my personal life and you seem to be such a nice man... but I'm talking too much again, no?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're so sweet. Oh, why are there not more men out there like you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know just the right thing to say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, you're the best assistant I've ever had... Gabrielle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) I like it when you say my name. Is that stupid?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan, in his pajamas, lies in bed reading. He looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The phone rings. Nathan picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan sits up in bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan puts down the phone and heads to the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan opens the bathroom door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila turns with a gasp. She has shaving cream all over her chest. Nathan looks stunned. He backs away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing in there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Nothing. Be right out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello? (beat, happily) Oh, hi... Gabrielle!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Who is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh-huh. Right, Gabrielle. Right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Who is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Absolutely, Gabrielle. (covering phone, testily) Someone from work! (into phone) Sorry about that, Gabrielle. Uh-huh. Exactly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Who from work?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Excuse me one second, would you, Gabrielle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Who is it, Nathan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Lila, when I'm on a work...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nathan, I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The lights are low. The room is peppered with lit candles. Gabrielle, in a slip, lies on her bed, eating cherries from a bowl, and listening to Nathan and Lila's conversation on speaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Footsteps and a door slam. Lila is near the phone now and crying in desperate heaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle calmly pops another cherry in her mouth and hangs up the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) It's hormonal, Nathan. I can't help it. I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Your entire body?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm getting electrolysis. It's working, but it takes time. So meanwhile I have to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) You have to shave? Like an ape?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (crying) Apes don't shave, you son of a bitch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Don't quibble. You know what I mean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm sorry. Please don't be mad at me for this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Mad? I'm I'm... disgusted!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm the same person I was before you knew, damn it! Oh God!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I have to think! I have to think!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Oh God, why... do... I... have... to... be... like... Oh, no! Oh, shit! (rustling sound, then into phone) Hello? Hello? Is anyone there? Who's there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan, in his pajamas, drives. His face is set in a furious scowl and he drives fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle drives leisurely. She is calm, a slight smile on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan paces in front of Puff's Lucite case. Puff watches suspiciously from the corner where he is huddled. The lights are off. But there is a green glow from a couple of exit signs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights flick on. Nathan turns with a start. It's Gabrielle. She's in an overcoat. She gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff is taken also. His eyes are wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle kneels by Puff's case. Puff crawls over, tries to touch her through the Lucite. Gabrielle sings a French lullaby. It's very sweet. Nathan watches her, looks at her thigh, her hair, the delicate way the tip of her nose moves when she sings. Puff gets drowsy. He curls up on the floor and sleeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan stares at her, transfixed. She pretends not to notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle stands. She stretches languorously, revealing a lot of leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle walks slowly by Nathan. He inhales deeply, breathing her in. She smiles to herself. He reaches out touches her leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves into Nathan. She presses her thigh against his shoulder. Nathan leans forward, kisses her exposed thigh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't get it. I don't get it. I don't get it. How could I find myself in this mess? This is a mess. This is not a situation I understand. This is a mess. How do I extricate myself from this mess? Is my girlfriend a man? I don't understand. This is not part of any plan. She deceived me. She has hair. (beat) But am I being fair? So what if she has hair? Who am I to judge? I have hair. (beat) But I'm supposed to have hair. I am a man. Men are supposed to have hair. (beat) But poor Lila. Think of what she's had to go through. The courage she's had to have in the face of this abomination of nature. I should love her all the more. I should love every hair on her body. I mean, she doesn't mind that I have a mortifyingly small...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Doctor. I did not know. I'm sorry to disturb you. I just came for some papers I left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gabrielle. No, I'm sorry if I startled you. I came to think. (beat, remembering) God, Did I hang up on you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oui. Perhaps I called at a bad time. I am sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I just got distracted. I'm so sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is everything fine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oui. (laughs) Now you've got me talking French.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) I was in my p.j.'s when I remembered I left some papers I need to go over. (opens overcoat to reveal lingerie) See? I rushed right out of the house. I must look a mess. I'm so embarrassed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taken) I'm in my p.j.'s, too. Funny, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Coincidence, yes? (beat) And how is our son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our...? Oh! (laughs, out of control) He seems fine. I guess we woke him. The lights and all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I should turn them off. (she does) Maybe I sing him a lullaby my mama sang to me when I was a little girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a little giddy) When you were a little French girl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oui.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (back in control) That would be good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly to Nathan) There.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shall we close up, then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we should just sit for a while. It's very peaceful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's nice, yes. I'm glad I ran into you, both in our silly pajamas. It is two happy coincidences, no?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. Happy happy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yet you look so sad. A great man like you should not be sad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm fine. Life is funny, that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am sleepy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I shouldn't say this, but you're pretty, Gabrielle. It's unprofessional, I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really? I always think myself so ugly. No, not ugly, but plain. A wallflower.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (buying her line) Really? No. Not at all. You're a very pretty girl. You should know that. You should be confident.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you so much. Merci. It's very wonderful to hear a man say such a nice compliment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's true. I wouldn't lie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are sweet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (vaguely protesting) Doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So soft. So smooth. (back to reality) I'm sorry. It's just...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (soothing) Shh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lila is shaving herself all over. Shaving and weeping. There are nicks all over her body. She has no eyebrows any more. The hair on her head is hacked off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan and Gabrielle are lying naked on the floor. Gabrielle rests her head on Nathan's chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan tenses. Gabrielle looks up innocently at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff watches from his case. Gabrielle smiles to herself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Was that okay? I mean, was I able to... satisfy you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are an animal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really? Wow! That's that's terrific to hear from someone so... feminine, so female.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love being female because it, how do you say, allows me to be close to men.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm glad you're female. (beat) Do you think our boy witnessed the primal scene?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anyway it's time he grew up. N'est- ce pa? (sighing, running her fingers along his chest) I love chest hair on a man. I know it isn't fashionable now, hairy men. But to me it is the very sign of masculinity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is wrong, my darling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing, my darling. All is right with the world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Puff testifies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The congressmen laugh appreciatively. The laughter is a little too enthusiastic and goes on a little too long. It stops abruptly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The congressmen nod sadly, in recognition of this reality.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I saw it, gentlemen. I saw the whole sweaty, passionate, ugly, beautiful act, and to use the vernacular, I wanted me some of that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I think I understood from that moment, that in order to get some, I would have to do what they said. In order to experience this primal, basic, animal thing, I would first have to become a civilized, prissy, uptight human. I would have to become Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Puff, in his Lucite case, sits behind a set dinner table. He seems attentive, calm, interested as Nathan teaches him table manners. Gabrielle stands very close, almost possessively close, to Nathan. She wears a lab coat, but it is unbuttoned, and underneath she is wearing a skin-tight black minidress. She strokes the back of Nathan's head as he works with Puff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wheels turn in Puff's head. He thinks hard. Then he stands. Gabrielle shrieks and claps happily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan leans over and kisses Gabrielle. Puff watches. He makes an exaggerated kissy-face, pursing his lips, trying to imitate Nathan. The phone rings. Gabrielle pulls herself away, giggles as Nathan tries to keep her from going, and picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (slow. talking to an idiot) Excellent, Puff. Now, the lady you're with excuses herself to go powder her nose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perfect. Perfect, Puff!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (still giggling) Dr. Bronfman's line. Yes. One moment please. (puts it on hold) Lila.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit. (takes phone) Hi, honey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lila sits on the couch. Eyebrows are attractively drawn onto her face. She wears a very femme blonde wing. Lots of make- up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So, how's it going today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Good. Making progress.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Honey, can we talk tonight? You know, about stuff? Things have been so strained for the past three weeks, since you know, and I just want to talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan, phone cradled between shoulder and ear, puts his face in his hand. Gabrielle rests a hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan looks up helplessly at Gabrielle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle gets mad, exhales sharply, pulls her hand away. Nathan gives her a pleading look, grabs for her. She moves away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Everything's fine, honey. We don't need to talk. Besides I have to work late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Please, Nathan. I really need this. You've been working late a lot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, we'll have dinner tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Okay. Be home around seven. Bye. (hangs up) What? I'm sorry. What was I supposed to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disgusted) I don't know, Nathan. What are you supposed to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't abandon somebody because they have a physical problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Funny. I thought that's exactly what you did. You just don't have the courage to admit it to yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan talks. A tear runs down his face, mingles with the blood.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Funny. I still feel guilt. Even dead. One would've hoped... But alas. You know, I really did love Lila. But with her... problem... and then when Gabrielle revealed her feelings. And Gabrielle was so... conventionally female. And she had an accent. I was lost from that moment on. But Gabrielle was right. I couldn't admit it to myself, this shallowness of character, let alone to Lila.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lila and Nathan eat. Lila is in her new, very feminine make- up, wig, and dress. Her table manners are impeccable, almost robotic. There is an awkward silence
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila holds out her hands. Her finger nails are polished fire engine red.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you seeing somebody else, Nathan? I just have to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It would just be helpful to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because, you know, you seem so distant. And you work late every night. And we hardly ever have sex, and when we do, it's... I don't know. It feels different.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm just preoccupied.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you like my new look?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. It's nice. It's really good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm trying, you know. (starting to cry) I'm trying to be what you want. I want to be what you want, Nathan. All I want is to be what you want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (embarrassed) Shh. It's okay. (takes her hand) It's okay, Lila. You're what I want. You know that. You're exactly what I want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hopefully, sniffing) Really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I'm really trying, you know. Rosie says maybe only another two years of the elctrolysis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hard to stomach) That's great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've signed up for a ballet class. And look at my nails! A real girl!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's great. It's a great color for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Nathan, let's have a baby!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lila holds and rocks a swaddled baby. She passes it to Nathan, who looks at it and sees that it's a baby monkey. Nathan shudders. Lila looks on lovingly, oblivious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan sits with his head in his hands. Wendall listens attentively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan puts his head in his hands and sighs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So anyway, that's the nightmare I've been having lately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you suppose it has anything to do with Lila's unusually hairy body?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) No, why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it seems that since Lila broached the subject of children, you've been on edge and I know you have an issue with the, uh, body hair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (revelation) Oh, I see. Yes, that's something to think about. That's very good. That's what you get the big bucks, right? Ha ha.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just think it might be important to explore your feelings for Lila.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love Lila. I mean, she's a wonderful person. And... she loves me! That's no small potatoes. I mean she really loves me. She's sacrificed so much to be in this relationship with me. And she's a good person. A truly good person. How rare is that in this world, eh? And how could I stop loving somebody because of a little physical imperfection, if it can even be called that. I mean, God knows I'm not perfect! What about my eyesight? It's lousy, that's what! Lila's not going to leave me because of my eyesight. What about my penis?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And how do you feel about Gabrielle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan is holding flash cards up to Puff. Puff tentatively reads aloud from the cards. Gabrielle sits nearby on a stool, fish-netted legs crossed, arms crossed, and an angry expression on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff smiles happily. Nathan and Puff both look over at Gabrielle for her approval. None is forthcoming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle stands, turns, and stomps across the room. Nathan follows her angry, switching hips with his eyes, as does Puff. She exits into the hall. Nathan looks at Puff and shrugs. Puff returns the shrug. Nathan follows Gabrielle into the hall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good-eve-n-ing-lay-dees-and-gent- elmen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bravo, Puff! Bravo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't Puff doing spectacularly, honey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmmmph.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gabby, what is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmmph. Hmmph. (beat) Nathan, we have to talk, you and I.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nathan laughs heartily, haughtily, at his joke as Lila and Puff climb down from the tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff looks at Lila. Lila shrugs helplessly. Puff reaches out to touch her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff looks at Lila again. She jerks her head in the direction of Nathan. Puff sighs and moves to Nathan. Nathan prods Puff, and they head off through the trees. Suddenly Puff elbows Nathan. Nathan grunts, doubles over. Puff turns, lunges, and the two wrestle on the ground. Puff pries the gun from Nathan's hand, and jumps up. Nathan stands also, backing away. Puff has the gun trained on Nathan. Lila runs to Puff, stands behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lila nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff shoots. A crow screams. The fluttering of wings. The bullet hits Nathan in the head. He falls.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Aha! Finally. I've covered almost the entire seaboard and parts of eastern Ohio.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ugnh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ugnh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh please, is that as articulate as you can be after all the time I spent teaching you? We've discussed Wittgenstein, for Christ's sake. Not that you ever had anything very original or challenging to say on the subject.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Unn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Down from the tree. Both of you. Keep your hands where I can see them. Don't want you pulling any weapons out of your fur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at you two. You both disgust me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oook. Oook.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up! (to Puff) I gave you... life. I created you in my image, Puff. I took you from this primordial ooze and brought you into the world of culture and art and manners. And this is how you repay me? By heading back to the ooze first chance you get? I should leave you here with Lila the ape woman. It would serve you right, you ungrateful piece of crap. But I'm not going to. You're too valuable to me. Totally selfish of me. You serve my purpose. But if you had any smarts you would realize that I serve your purpose as well. Life is so much more delightful when lived in a silk suit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ooka.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, Lila. You can stay. I don't have any interest in you anymore. (to Puff) C'mon, monkey boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Puff, put the gun down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ounpoo. Ungh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's be reasonable human beings here. We're all reasonable human beings, aren't we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumping up and down like a chimp) Unka unka unka unka unka.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, why don't you and Lila stay here and have your natural life. I'll just go on my way. You'll never see me again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Lila, guiltily) I have to talk. Is that okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Nathan) You did create me in your image, Nathan. Before you I was a simple, happy, complete being, in harmony with the world around me. After you I became duplicitous, cynical, angry, anal, totally out of touch with my surroundings. In a word, Nathan, I became you. Lila has reintroduced me to myself. And, incidentally, what I'm about to do, kill you, is something that would never have occurred to me to do as a creature of the Earth. Before when I killed, it was for food or in self-defense. Now I will kill for revenge. Revenge is an abstract concept, Nathan. And I learned abstract thinking from you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Puff, don't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lila sobs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then I shot Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Puff dabs his eye.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then Lila shot Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nathan talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We move into an extreme close-up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then Puff shot me. Then I died. That's all I know. That's the end of my story. Do I get to go to heaven now? (beat) Or is it... hell? (beat) Or... what? (beat) I just stay here, is it? I just stay here and tell it again? And after that? Again? And after... (sighs) Yes. Yes, of course. (sighs, clears his throat)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beginning again) I don't even know what sorry means anymore. It's odd. When I was alive I knew -- maybe it was all I knew...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lila runs to Nathan. She kneels beside him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) We bury the body. We disappear into the woods. Nobody knows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat, then quietly) No. This is the end of the road. There's a dead human being here. For all of his faults, he was a human being, and certainly a victim of his culture as much as anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget him, Lila. We'll disappear. We'll never talk about it again. We'll never talk again period. I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Puff, what happened to you is as much my fault as Nathan's. Maybe more so, because I knew it was wrong and I went along with it anyway. I'm taking responsibility for the murder. I want you to go back to your old life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't let you do that. I shot the bastard. And I'm glad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Go back to the woods. This is a sacrifice I need to make. In my world we have something called penance. It's another abstraction, but I had the concept drummed into my head during my years in the convent. It doesn't exist for you, and it shouldn't. See, I could never be free again anyway, so I might as well be in jail.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) Then I'll live for both of us, Lila. I'll be the most free, truest animal in the whole forest. For both of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (tearing up) That's what I'm counting on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (an idea) But first I'll live among them, just long enough to testify before congress about the waywardness of humankind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs) Okay. If you think it will help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lila, now in prison coveralls, sits in a dayroom with other women convicts. She is watching a TV mounted on the wall. Puff is testifying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff stands and exits the auditorium. Flashbulbs flash. In the prison common room, Lila wipes a tear from her eye. She seems genuinely happy. She looks out a small barred window and sees a bluebird light there, then fly away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And so, gentlemen, that is my story. I agreed to testify before this committee because I hoped to convey to the American public that there is indeed a paradise lost. Human beings have become so enamored of their technologies and their intellectual prowess and their fancy gourmet foods, that they've forgotten to look to the Earth as a teacher. This is hubris, my friends. And my story of destruction and betrayal is proof of that. I will keep my promise to Lila. I will shed this suit and go back into the wilderness. I will live out my days naked and free.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, sir. Your story has touched us all deeply. We will pass some legislation addressing this problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you. That is all I ask. (to camera) Good-bye, Lila. I take you with me in my untamed heart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Puff walks along, a man on a mission. As he walks he sheds articles of clothing. He is followed by reporters and cameramen and celebrity hounds. Soon he is naked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff walks along, naked. People cheer from porches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff walks along. He is still followed by reporters. Cows watch the parade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff walks along a dirt road. He is about to disappear into the forest. An older woman rushes out from the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The older woman starts to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puff holds out his hand for her to shake. Flashbulbs flash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His mother weeps. Puff gently rests his hand on her shoulder for a moment, then he turns and waves to the reporters. The crowd bursts into applause. Flashbulbs flash. Puff jogs into the woods. There is a collective sigh, and then everyone turns and heads back in the direction from which they came. We hold on the woods for a moment. A car pulls up. Puff hurries out of the woods and jumps in the passenger side of the car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning) Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw you on C-Span. I've been looking for you for thirty years. Then there you were, such a beautiful, beautiful grown man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... Derek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (formally) It's a pleasure to meet you, mother. But I'm an ape like dad was... (checks watch) And I have to go back into the woods now... forever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (resigned) Yes, I suppose so. I suppose I knew that was going to be what you would say. It's good to see you again though.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm in the book, if you ever want to drop me a line or something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm an ape, mom. I'm an ape. And apes don't drop lines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Puff leans over and kisses Gabrielle, who is driving the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle giggles. Puff kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This turns Gabrielle on. She kisses him passionately. When the kiss runs its course, Puff speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gabrielle kisses him again, even more passionately this time
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They smile flirtatiously at each other. Puff leans over and kisses Gabrielle's neck.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, my little boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, ma. Did you bring any clothes? I'm freezing my ass off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oui. Nathan's silk suit, just like you asked.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Great. (putting on suit) God, I've wanted you forever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say my name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gabrielle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyes glistening) You remind me so much of Nathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like father, like son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stroking his face) You remind me so much of Nathan plus so much of my little mongrel doggie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Woof.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Arf.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As much as I loved Nathan, I'm not sorry she killed him, if it means I can have you. Is that a terrible thing to say, my sweet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (putting her finger to his lips) Hush. No, it is never terrible to be in love. Nathan's memory lives on in our sacred union. (beat) I'm not sorry she killed him either. Nathan was wonderful. He was erudite and sophisticated and charming. You are all that, too. But you have something more. You have a bit of the animal in you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's go eat, I'm starved.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: French?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oui.
dialogue.name: dialogue
